events.originalText: North Korea conducted its sixth and most powerful nuclear test at Punggye-ri, causing a magnitude-6.3 earthquake.
events.subtitle: 2017 North Korean nuclear test
events.headline: North Korea conducts sixth nuclear test at Punggye-ri

events.originalText: The Troubles: Ulster loyalists resumed a picket outside a Catholic girls' primary school in the Protestant portion of Ardoyne, in Belfast, Northern Ireland.
events.subtitle: The Troubles
events.headline: Ulster loyalists picket outside Catholic girls' school in Ardoyne

events.originalText: A fire killed 25 people locked inside a burning chicken processing plant in Hamlet, North Carolina, U.S.
events.subtitle: Hamlet chicken processing plant fire
events.headline: Fire kills 25 at chicken processing plant in Hamlet, North Carolina

events.originalText: In a military coup d'état in Burundi, Pierre Buyoya deposed the incumbent president Jean-Baptiste Bagaza while he was abroad in Canada.
events.subtitle: 1987 Burundian coup d'état
events.headline: Military coup in Burundi as Pierre Buyoya deposes president

events.originalText: The Holocaust: In possibly the first Jewish ghetto uprising, residents of the Łachwa Ghetto in occupied Poland, informed of the upcoming "liquidation" of the ghetto, unsuccessfully fought against their Nazi captors.
events.subtitle: The Holocaust
events.headline: Residents of Łachwa Ghetto fight against Nazi captors

events.originalText: The Guild of Carillonneurs in North America was founded in Parliament Hill, Ottawa, Canada.
events.subtitle: The Guild of Carillonneurs in North America
events.headline: Guild of Carillonneurs in North America founded in Ottawa

events.originalText: On the Bonneville Salt Flats in Utah, British racing motorist Malcolm Campbell became the first person to drive an automobile over 300 mph (480 km/h).
events.subtitle: Bonneville Salt Flats
events.headline: Malcolm Campbell drives over 300 mph on Bonneville Salt Flats

events.originalText: The flag of Australia flew for the first time, from the Royal Exhibition Building (pictured) in Melbourne.
events.subtitle: Flag of Australia
events.headline: Flag of Australia flies for the first time in Melbourne

events.originalText: The passenger steamship SS Princess Alice sank in the River Thames after colliding (pictured) with the collier Bywell Castle, killing more than 600 people.
events.subtitle: Sinking of SS Princess Alice
events.headline: SS Princess Alice sinks in River Thames, over 600 dead

events.originalText: American Revolutionary War: The British Army and their Hessian allies defeated an American militia at the Battle of Cooch's Bridge.
events.subtitle: American Revolutionary War
events.headline: British Army defeats American militia at Battle of Cooch's Bridge

events.originalText: English Parliamentarian forces under Oliver Cromwell (pictured) won the Battle of Worcester, the final battle of the English Civil War.
events.subtitle: Roundhead
events.headline: Oliver Cromwell wins Battle of Worcester in English Civil War

events.originalText: Under Oliver Cromwell, the English New Model Army ambushed a poorly prepared Scottish force at the Battle of Dunbar, the first battle of the Third English Civil War.
events.subtitle: Oliver Cromwell
events.headline: English New Model Army ambushes Scottish force at Battle of Dunbar

events.originalText: The Treaty of Selymbria was concluded between the Republic of Venice and the Ottoman prince Musa Çelebi.
events.subtitle: Treaty of Selymbria
events.headline: Treaty of Selymbria concluded between Venice and Ottoman prince

events.originalText: Arab–Byzantine wars: The Byzantine Empire decisively defeated the Emirate of Melitene at the Battle of Lalakaon, beginning the era of Byzantine ascendancy.
events.subtitle: Arab–Byzantine wars
events.headline: Byzantine Empire defeats Emirate of Melitene at Battle of Lalakaon

events.originalText: The Sicilian revolt against the Second Triumvirate of the Roman Republic ended when the fleet of Sextus Pompey, the rebel leader, was defeated at the Battle of Naulochus.
events.subtitle: Bellum Siculum
events.headline: Sicilian revolt ends with defeat of Sextus Pompey at Battle of Naulochus
